pull_request.title: Bump crypto-js from 4.1.1 to 4.2.0 in /webclient
pull_request.body:
Bumps [crypto-js](https://github.com/brix/crypto-js) from 4.1.1 to 4.2.0.
Commits
  • 808f499 Merge branch 'release/4.2.0'
  • d5af3ae Update release notes.
  • 9496e07 Bump version.
  • 421dd53 Change default hash algorithm and iteration's for PBKDF2 to prevent weak secu...
  • d1f4f4d Update grunt.
  • c755289 Discontinued
  • 1da3dab Discontinued
  • 4dcaa7a Merge pull request #380 from Alanscut/dev
  • 762feb2 chore: rename BF to Blowfish
  • fb81418 feat: blowfish support
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

issue.title: macOS 12/13 occasionally failing
issue.body:
macOS 12 example: https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/actions/runs/6614690847/job/17965213572?pr=4922 ``` CPack: - Run preinstall target for: Cockatrice CPack: - Install project: Cockatrice [] CPack: Create package CPack Error: Error executing: osascript "/Users/runner/work/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/cmake/CMakeDMGSetup.script" "Cockatrice" CPack Error: Error executing custom script on disk image. osascript: can't open default scripting component. CPack Error: Problem compressing the directory CPack Error: Error when generating package: Cockatrice make: *** [package] Error 1 Error: Process completed with exit code 2. ``` macOS 13 example: https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/actions/runs/6632768476/job/18019167204?pr=4871 ``` CPack: - Run preinstall target for: Cockatrice CPack: - Install project: Cockatrice [] CPack: Create package CPack Error: Error executing: /usr/bin/hdiutil create -ov -srcfolder "/Users/runner/work/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/build/_CPack_Packages/OSX/DragNDrop/Cockatrice-2.9.0-custom(6f88419)" -volname "Cockatrice" -fs "HFS+" -format UDRW "/Users/runner/work/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/build/_CPack_Packages/OSX/DragNDrop/temp.dmg" CPack Error: Error generating temporary disk image. hdiutil: create failed - Resource busy CPack Error: Problem compressing the directory CPack Error: Error when generating package: Cockatrice make: *** [package] Error 1 Error: Process completed with exit code 2. ```
A rerun fixes the issue normally.

issue.title: CI: Cleanup & updates
issue.body:
## Related Ticket(s)
- Linking #4883
- Fixes #4777

## Short roundup of the initial problem
No more 32bit offerd on Windows
Outdated versions

## What will change with this Pull Request?
Windows:
- Simplifications for config file and binary file names
- Use Qt 6.5 LTS on Windows 10 (also fixes some Qt5 error messages for me)

macOS:
- Update Xcode versions to latest available for the respective macOS line

comment.body: we do sometimes get people asking why there is no win 11 built though, the + is supposed to signify it is also compatible with win11, people often don't read the + though, I'm not sure what to add to make clear to people that the win10 build is also for win11

commits.message:
Rename "stack until found" feature (#4871)

* Rename "stack until found" feature

* lint

pull_request.title: Rename "stack until found" feature
pull_request.body:
## Related Ticket(s) - Related #4648 - Related #4864 ## Short roundup of the initial problem I find the selected "Take top cards until" wording of the recently added "move cards from top of library until" not great. ## What will change with this Pull Request? - Use "Put top cards on stack until" phrasing, to stay in line with the rest of the options and be more clear of the action: - Tried to improve the dialog
>Which "search syntax" is actually supported in the follow-up dialog? E.g. `mv<4 -t:land` for cascading

comment.body:
> this will break the updater again by changing the name of the build artifact

It won't? The changed Windows binaries are still found by the updater as far as I understand [the code](https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/blob/master/cockatrice/src/releasechannel.cpp#L71).

pull_request.title: TOTD: Exchange Gitter for Discord, Fix date format
pull_request.body: ## Short roundup of the initial problem Gitter is no longer used. Fix very unusual date format YYYY.MM.DD. ## What will change with this Pull Request? - Add Discord community - Picture taken from https://discord.com/branding - Use international date format (screenshot has old one still) ## Screenshots

issue.title: macOS 10.15 failing
issue.body:
Our macOS 10.15 build is failing because Homebrew removed [protobuf](https://formulae.brew.sh/formula/protobuf) (and now also [protobuf@21](https://formulae.brew.sh/formula/protobuf@21)) bottles for it.
macOS 12 is also occasionally failing when creating the package: https://github.com/Cockatrice/Cockatrice/actions/runs/6614690847/job/17965213572?pr=4922

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: github_actions
labels.description: Pull requests that update GitHub Actions code

issue.body:
Bumps [jurplel/install-qt-action](https://github.com/jurplel/install-qt-action) from 3 to 4.
Release notes

Sourced from jurplel/install-qt-action's releases.

install-qt-action v3.3.0

  • Add libgstreamer (@​ddalcino)
  • Add option to install source, docs, and examples (@​ddalcino)

install-qt-action v3.2.1

  • add back automatic libxkbcommon-x11-0 installation on linux

install-qt-action v3.2.0

  • Fix py7zr weirdness (@​ddalcino)

install-qt-action v3.1.0

  • Fix detection of Qt architecture directory thanks to @​ddalcino
Commits
  • 51b9abd Try to build v4
  • 0639a65 merge
  • 8957947 add back libxkbcommon-x11-0 dependency on linux
  • 5e6aabb Merge pull request #189 from ddalcino/use-auto-desktop
  • 6cf14df Merge branch 'master' into use-auto-desktop
  • 6f7dd7e Merge pull request #190 from ddalcino/topic/fix-qt5_dir-env-var
  • b0a26e3 Merge pull request #179 from ddalcino/topic/add-src-doc-examples
  • ecc7eab Merge pull request #186 from ddalcino/patch-1
  • f76dbc3 Add test that runs CMake on the sample project
  • 5be1905 Update environment variables
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=jurplel/install-qt-action&package-manager=github_actions&previous-version=3&new-version=4)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

comment.body:
OK, I won't notify you again about this release, but will get in touch when a new version is available. If you'd rather skip all updates until the next major or minor version, let me know by commenting `@dependabot ignore this major version` or `@dependabot ignore this minor version`. You can also ignore all major, minor, or patch releases for a dependency by adding an [`ignore` condition](https://docs.github.com/en/code-security/supply-chain-security/configuration-options-for-dependency-updates#ignore) with the desired `update_types` to your config file.

If you change your mind, just re-open this PR and I'll resolve any conflicts on it.

issue.title: drag & drop grid placement reliabilitity
issue.body:
<!--                   READ THIS BEFORE POSTING
Go to "Help → View Debug Log" in Cockatrice and copy all information at the
top (above the separation line) below "System Information" in this ticket!
If you can't start Cockatrice to access these details, make
sure to post your OS and the file name of the setup binary instead. -->

_______________________________________________________________________________________

<!-- Explain your issue in detail here! Please attach screenshots if possible. -->

I want to organize my board by dragging permanents into neat groups, but Cockatrice unfortunately has confusing drag & drop behavior. The grid often forces permanents far to the left of where I want to drop them, or else far to the right. The drag & drop grid can be too sticky in terms of forcing groupings of 3 cards, when I merely want to position a permanent next to another group of 1-3 permanent bundles.

_______________________________________________________________________________________

<!-- Describe the sequence of actions needed to experience the bug -->

**Steps to reproduce:**
 - Drag and drop some tokens around, such as 1/1 red Elementals.

I'm using macOS, in case that matters.

comment.body:
I understand that's annoying but I can't reproduce your problem on my own machine, I'm not sure how I can work on fixing your issue if I can't determine what causes it.

in the mean time we have released cockatrice 2.9.0, please check if installing the new version resolves your issue.

I don't like the "advanced" label, we only have one search syntax, https://scryfall.com/docs/syntax doesn't call it advanced either, maybe just call them "search expressions" instead of syntax which might be a less used word.

pull_request.title: Rename "stack until found" feature
pull_request.body:
## Related Ticket(s) - Related #4648 - Related #4864 ## Short roundup of the initial problem I find the selected "Take top cards until" wording of the recently added "move cards from top of library until" not great. ## What will change with this Pull Request? - Use "Put top cards on stack until" phrasing, to stay in line with the rest of the options and be more clear of the action: - Tried to improve the dialog
Which "search syntax" is actually supported in the follow-up dialog?

repo.name: Cockatrice
repo.description: A cross-platform virtual tabletop for multiplayer card games
